entry.content:
Follow the basic instructions in the install PDF: make the installer executable and run it.

You will then be given a list of missing packages (if any). Install these.

If running the installer again gives an error, then it is looking for specific names that do not match the libraries you have just installed. To bypass this check (because you are certain you have installed the files) type:

SKIP_PACKAGE_CHECK=1 ./DaVinci_Resolve_18.5b1_Linux.run

Of course, if you need to have the executable above match your downloaded file.

entry.title: Tumbleweed USB printer sharing fix
entry.summary: I have a printer that shared perfectly well with Ubuntu, but after transitioning my server to OpenSUSE Tumbleweed it would periodically disappear after server reboot. The problem turns out to be an error caused by a change in the CUPS printer server making it not…
entry.content:
I have a printer that shared perfectly well with Ubuntu, but after transitioning my server to OpenSUSE Tumbleweed it would periodically disappear after server reboot.

The problem turns out to be an error caused by a change in the CUPS printer server making it not share USB printers very well anymore.

The fix requires adding an older protocol to your configuration settings. This can be done through the web interface on the Administration page under the Server section. Make sure BrowseRemoteProtocols also has CUPS listed next to it.

BrowseRemoteProtocols CUPS

entry.content:
From the "Well, now that it affects me" department

Christianity Today is reporting that Brent Leatherwood, the president of the Southern Baptist Convention's Ethics and Religious Liberty Commission is concerned with gun violence. This follows the mass shooting at the Covenant School in Nashville where his children attend.

Leatherwood has had plenty of time to address this as he was previously the executive director of the Tennessee GOP; and now, with twenty percent of Tennessee's residents being Southern Baptist, he has those ears as well. But his department was busy with other issues of morality and life. Maybe he thought the 2018 Southern Baptist resolution "On Gun Violence and Mass Shootings" was enough, when it actually comes across as little more than "thoughts and prayers".

Solutions to gun violence have been a hard sell to those who have yet to suffer from it. Sadly, I guess we know what it's going to take to change things.

The first of the three religious books I have available at GodsValueSystem.com is God's Value System.

God's Value System

God's Value System develops the theology of understanding God and biblical issues in terms of relationship with God. Buy it on Amazon.com

Jesus never intended the Gospel to be something that only affected life after death. His message of good news begins right now in this life. An inadequate understanding of the Gospel fails to bring the values of Christ's Kingdom into our lives. However, a true understanding of the relational blessings that God provides for us brings transformation to all of our relationships.

Here are a few of the ideas covered in this book:

  • the basis for relationship with God
  • the relational nature of theology
  • the Gospel in its most basic and complete form
  • the failure of relationship through legalism
  • clearly defining the nature of worship and holiness
  • evangelism that focuses on value system
  • the primary purpose of prayer

As you read this book, you will refocus your attention on what Jesus taught about his Kingdom, and what he declared to be good news.

Relationship with God

Relationships are based on what you have in common with another person, whether family, work, hobbies, or religion. Truly knowing a person, including God, is entirely dependent on knowing what that person values; and deepening relationship requires agreement and unity in what you value most. In order to have a good and meaningful relationship with someone, you must hold in common that which is most important to you. This is no different in our relationship with God. Relationship with God must be based on our adopting values that are like his, and removing from our lives anything we value that he does not. The only measure of Christian growth in Christ-likeness is how much we have become like him in terms of value system. Therefore, we must be sure we truly understand what God values. If we misunderstand God's value system, then we misunderstand who he is. If we do not know what God values, then we cannot be sure that we are even becoming like him.

How can we know what God values?

God has revealed his value system, although many have misunderstood or misrepresented it. Only through an examination of the Gospel of the Kingdom can we know God's value system. We must be very sure we understand the Gospel without adding or subtracting from it, because if we fail to clearly comprehend the teachings of Jesus, we will be severely hindered in knowing and becoming like him. God's value system is sacrificial love for the benefit of others, and it most looks like Jesus on the cross. If we are to be like him, we must understand this truth fully and seek to become like him in loving others sacrificially.
